text:
### Revolutionizing Weather Forecasting with the Space-Time Transformer: Meet WeatherFormer

In a world increasingly dependent on accurate weather forecasts, traditional Numerical Weather Prediction (NWP) systems face significant challenges. These systems rely on solving complex partial differential equations using massive computing clusters, which not only consume vast amounts of energy but also contribute to carbon emissions. The need for efficient and eco-friendly solutions has never been more urgent, and that's where WeatherFormer comes in.

#### What is WeatherFormer?

WeatherFormer is a revolutionary AI-based NWP framework designed to model the intricate spatio-temporal dynamics of the atmosphere. Unlike traditional methods that are computationally intensive, WeatherFormer leverages space-time transformers to provide accurate weather predictions while significantly reducing computational costs and environmental impact.

#### The Power of Space-Time Transformers

At the heart of WeatherFormer is the space-time transformer, a novel architecture that excels in handling complex spatio-temporal data. Traditional transformers are known for their ability to process sequential data, but they struggle with the multidimensional nature of weather patterns. WeatherFormer addresses this by introducing space-time factorized transformer blocks, which break down the problem into manageable parts.

One of the key innovations is the Position-aware Adaptive Fourier Neural Operator (PAFNO). This operator ensures that each token in the transformer is aware of its spatial position, making the model more sensitive to location-specific atmospheric conditions. By doing so, WeatherFormer can better capture and predict the nuanced dynamics of weather systems.

#### Eco-Friendly and Efficient

One of the most significant advantages of WeatherFormer is its eco-friendliness. Traditional NWP systems require enormous amounts of computational power, leading to high energy consumption and carbon emissions. WeatherFormer, on the other hand, uses advanced data augmentation strategies to reduce training costs and improve performance. These strategies not only make the model more efficient but also ensure that it can be deployed at scale without a significant environmental footprint.

#### Superior Performance

The effectiveness of WeatherFormer has been demonstrated through extensive experiments on the WeatherBench dataset, a benchmark for evaluating weather prediction models. The results show that WeatherFormer outperforms existing deep learning methods and approaches the accuracy of the most advanced physical models. This is a remarkable achievement, as it bridges the gap between AI-based and physics-based approaches to NWP.

#### Real-World Applications

The potential applications of WeatherFormer are vast. Accurate weather forecasting is crucial for various sectors, including agriculture, aviation, and disaster management. For farmers, precise predictions can help optimize planting and harvesting schedules. For airlines, accurate forecasts can improve flight planning and safety. And in regions prone to natural disasters, reliable weather information can save lives by enabling timely evacuations and preparations.

#### Looking Ahead

The development of WeatherFormer marks a significant step forward in the field of meteorology. As AI continues to advance, we can expect even more sophisticated models that further enhance our ability to predict and understand weather patterns. The future is bright for sustainable and accurate weather forecasting, and WeatherFormer is leading the way.

In conclusion, WeatherFormer represents a paradigm shift in how we approach numerical weather prediction. By combining cutting-edge AI with eco-friendly practices, it offers a promising solution to one of the most critical challenges facing modern society. As we move towards a more sustainable future, WeatherFormer will play a vital role in ensuring that our weather forecasts are both accurate and environmentally responsible.

abstract: Abstract: Numerical Weather Prediction (NWP) system is an infrastructure that exerts considerable impacts on modern society.Traditional NWP system, however, resolves it by solving complex partial differential equations with a huge computing cluster, resulting in tons of carbon emission. Exploring efficient and eco-friendly solutions for NWP attracts interest from Artificial Intelligence (AI) and earth science communities. To narrow the performance gap between the AI-based methods and physic predictor, this work proposes a new transformer-based NWP framework, termed as WeatherFormer, to model the complex spatio-temporal atmosphere dynamics and empowering the capability of data-driven NWP. WeatherFormer innovatively introduces the space-time factorized transformer blocks to decrease the parameters and memory consumption, in which Position-aware Adaptive Fourier Neural Operator (PAFNO) is proposed for location sensible token mixing. Besides, two data augmentation strategies are utilized to boost the performance and decrease training consumption. Extensive experiments on WeatherBench dataset show WeatherFormer achieves superior performance over existing deep learning methods and further approaches the most advanced physical model.
